element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm calculates cross sections from a DEM an a given route

element.name: ROUTE
element.text: A layer containing routes. Cross sections will be perpendicular to the routes in this layer

element.name: DISTANCE
element.text: The distance between section sections along a route, in map units

element.name: WIDTH
element.text: The width of each half of a section, that is, from the central axis (the line defining the route), to the extreme of the section

element.name: NUMPOINTS
element.text: Number of points to be measured in each half of the cross section. For instance, if a section width of 100 is used and you give this field a value of 10, the algorithm will place points separated by 10 meters along the cross section.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The new layer contains the cross sections. Its attributes table contains the elevations in the points measured along the cross section. The number of fields in the table is, thus, variable, depending on the number of points specified

image.description: Cross sections, red lines (in blue, the vector lines layer defined in the route parameter).
